title: 2024 Trump Transition Briefing Materials (OSTP) - Pandemic and Infectious Disease Planning

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 2024 Trump Transition Briefing Materials (OSTP) - Pandemic and Infectious Disease Planning
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the pandemic or infectious disease primary briefing materials created by the Office of Science and Technology Policy (OSTP) for purposes of the Presidential Transition Process. Specifically this is a request for any presentations created for, or delivered to, members of the Presidential Transition Team for the new Administration (2nd Trump term) in November and December 2024. Please include any materials (documents, Excel files, PowerPoint presentations, audio/visual) from the President’s Council of Advisors on Science and Technology (or "PCAST") which is under the umbrella of the Office of Science of Technology Policy. 

Of particular interest is information related to pandemic planning or deliberations related to executive branch planning for the responses to the spread of infectious diseases such as HIV, Monkeypox, COVID-19, West Nile virus, Coxsackie, H1N1, etc. 

According to several books and much media coverage, President Trump claimed at the outset of the COVID-19 that there was no nearly no documentation or planning shared during the 2016/2017 transition related to pandemic planning, while members of the Obama administration have publicly claimed that OSTP pandemic planning documents were ignored. Any documents related to the efficacy of the Biden administration's response to Monkeypox or Covid-19 or HIV would be of particular interest. 

Thank you to the Office of Science and Technology Policy's commitment to transparency. The release of these documents would be of a great public benefit in understanding the pandemic and the public health challenges we face.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Incident Reports

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Incident Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Last week, I submitted a request for records related to an incident on November 5th, where police responded to a report of an election judge striking another individual with a cane at a polling site. The locations associated with this incident are either 2700 N Sheffield Ave, Chicago, IL, 60614, or the intersection of W 63rd St & S Knox Ave, Chicago, IL, 60629. The original request sought the following: Incident Reports, 911 Audio, Dispatch Recordings, Body Cam Footage, and a CAD Log. However, the request was denied in full on the grounds of being overly broad in scope. I would like to emphasize that, under FOIA guidelines, if certain portions of a request are deemed too broad or are otherwise exempt, the department should not deny the request in full. Instead, the agency is obligated to produce any non-exempt records that are reasonably identifiable and within scope. Additionally, Incident Reports are a standard type of document routinely requested and disclosed by this agency. In fact, I have previously received such reports from the Chicago Police Department without the need for separate or narrowed requests. I respectfully request that this standard practice be applied to this case as well. 

To facilitate this process, I am submitting a revised, narrower request:

Incident Report: Any incident or police report(s) prepared in connection to a November 5th, where police responded to a report of an election judge striking another individual with a cane at a polling site. The locations associated with this incident are either 2700 N Sheffield Ave, Chicago, IL, 60614, or the intersection of W 63rd St & S Knox Ave, Chicago, IL, 60629.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: Gender Reassignment in Wythe County Schools

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Gender Reassignment in Wythe County Schools
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to records from the Wythe County School District concerning gender reassignment surgeries. Specifically, I seek:

1. Communications and Correspondence:
- Any communications between the Wythe County School District and:
-- Wythe County Board of Supervisors
-- Virginia Department of Education
-- U.S. Department of Education
-- U.S. Department of Health and Human Services
- These communications should pertain to plans, grants, initiatives, or programs related to performing gender reassignment surgeries on students.

2. Policies and Procedures:
- Documents outlining the district's policies or procedures regarding gender reassignment surgeries for students.

3. Grant Applications and Funding:
- Records of any grant applications or funding received or sought for programs involving gender reassignment surgeries for students.

Please note, I am not requesting any personally identifiable information (PII) of any minor student.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Robert McWhirter.

title: Men Firing Rifles on Washington St.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to any and all records, reports, or other documents related to the incident on 9 November, 2024 at approximately 9:10 AM in the vicinity of E. Washington St & 3rd St, wherein two individuals were reported walking down the street, brandishing and discharging long arms. Specifically, I request:

911 Call Records
- Audio recordings, transcripts, and logs of the 911 call(s) made regarding this incident, including my own call and any other calls reporting the same or related events.
- Information about any calls to non-emergency police lines related to this incident.

Law Enforcement Actions
- Reports of any police interactions with witnesses, suspects, or other individuals regarding the incident.
- Notes, narratives, or descriptions of actions taken by responding officers or investigators.
- Documentation of outcomes related to the incident, including arrests, charges, or other resolutions.

Case Reports or Investigative Documents
- Any incident reports, supplemental reports, or internal memos related to this incident.
I
 am willing to pay any reasonable fees associated with fulfilling this request. However, if the cost exceeds [dollar amount, e.g., $50], please contact me first to discuss options.

If any part of my request is unclear or overly broad, I request that you contact me to clarify or refine my request. If any of the requested records are withheld, please provide a specific citation to the exemption being claimed under the applicable FOIA law and describe how it applies to the information being withheld.

I request the documents be provided to me electronically via email, if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert McWhirter

title: Appeal to IDA Letter 2025-00131-F

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Appeal to IDA Letter 2025-00131-F
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all documents, memoranda, e-mails, requests, approvals, reports, including technical reports associated with Project Grant W81XWH2211105 titled "TRAUMATIC BRAIN INJURY AND PSYCHOLOGICAL HEALTH RESEARCH PROGRAM" in the amount of $750,000 and sub-award WSU23001 in the amount of  $218,562  to Michigan State University from January 1, 2022 to November 1, 2024. Specifically, this grant and sub-award are described on USASpending.gov:

https://www.usaspending.gov/award/ASST_NON_W81XWH2211105_2100

My initial FOIA request was rejected with the following text: "There are no records responsive to your request. There were no technical or research reports for this project." See IDA Letter 2025-00131-F. I am sending a copy of this IDA letter to DHA.FOIAappeals@health.mil , as requested in the said letter.

I want to draw your attention to the fact that $750,000 were paid to Wayne State University by the DOD. This included a sub-award WSU23001 in the amount of  $218,562  to Michigan State University. Sub-award description found on the same USAspending.gov page is as follows:

'IN TECHNICAL OBJECTIVE #1, WE WILL EXPOSE GYRENCEPHALIC FERRETS (N = 48), WHICH ARE UNLIKE LISSENCEPHALIC ANIMALS (MICE AND RATS), TO RF WAVES FOR TWO HOURS/DAY FOR SIXTY DAYS USING A SOURCE 
 OF ELECTROMAGNETIC RADIATION WHICH WILL RESULT IN AN EXPOSURE PROFILE THAT IS LIKELY COMPARABLE TO THAT WHICH OUR EMBASSY PERSONNEL RECEIVED. SOME ADDITIONAL ANIMALS (N = 24) WILL RECEIVE SHAM EXPOSURE. IT IS NECESSARY TO HAVE AN ANIMAL MODEL WITH THE BRAIN STRUCTURES RESEMBLING THE GYRENCEPHALIC NATURE OF THE HUMAN BRAIN; MICE AND RATS DO NOT FULFIL THOSE CRITERIA.
 
 IN TECHNICAL OBJECTIVE #2, WE WILL ASSESS WHETHER RF WAVE EXPOSURE RESULTS IN COGNITIVE, BEHAVIORAL, COCHLEAR, OR VESTIBULAR CHANGES AMONG THE FERRETS AFTER TWO MONTHS COMPARED TO SHAM 
 EXPOSED ANIMALS.
 
PROJECT MILESTONES
 OUR MILESTONES WILL BE: (1) FULL ADMINISTRATIVE APPROVAL AT TWO MONTHS; (2) TESTING OF RF WAVE GENERATOR/RECEIVERS BY THE FOURTH MONTH; (3) TESTING COHORTS OF FERRETS [8 FERRETS/MONTH] FOR RF WAVE EXPOSURE WITH BEHAVIORAL, RADIOGRAPHIC, HISTOPATHOLOGY AND MOLECULAR ANALYSES BETWEEN FOUR AND 
 TWELVE MONTHS; (4) FINAL DATA ANALYSES AT ONE YEAR."

The statement of rejection issued in the IDA Letter 2025-00131-F doesn't  conform with the information available on the USAspending.gov webpage describing Project Grant FAIN W81XWH2211105 and sub-award WSU23001:

https://www.usaspending.gov/award/ASST_NON_W81XWH2211105_2100

Request for Expedited Processing

I am filing this request in my role as a Board Member for Targeted Justice, Inc., a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization, and a news organization.

Targeted Justice's status as a news organization that provides information of public interest to its members warrants the expedited processing of this Request on the grounds that there is a compelling need for these records because the information requested is urgently needed by an organization primarily engaged in disseminating information in order to inform the public about actual or alleged Federal Government activity. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2); 28 C.F.R. § n16.5(d)(1)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

Targeted Justice currently has over 16,000 subscribers and over 130,000 thousand views a month in its Substack newsletter. Thus, pursuant to 47 CFR 0.466 it is a news media organization.

Targeted Justice also requests the expedited processing of this request on the grounds that the records and documents requested relate to a “breaking news story of general public interest”. Furthermore, they present a “matter of widespread and exceptional media interest in which there exist possible questions about the government’s integrity which affect public confidence”. Expedited processing is warranted when “the information is relevant to a subject of public urgency concerning an actual or alleged Federal government activity” See 22 C.F.R. § 171.12(b)(2)(i); 32 C.F.R. § 286.4(d)(3)(ii)(A); see also 28 C.F.R. § 16.5(d)(1)(iv); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.34(c)(2).

In light of the above, Targeted Justice requests that your agency adheres to the legal mandate contained in 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i); see 28 C.F.R. § 16.6(b), (c) and consequently produce within 20 days of receipt of this request the information sought.

Request for Fee Waiver

Targeted Justice hereby requests a fee waiver of search, review, and duplication fees on the grounds that disclosure of the requested records is “in the public interest because it is likely to significantly contribute to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.” See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii); see also 22 C.F.R. § 171.17(a); 28 C.F.R. § 16.11(k); 32 C.F.R. § 286.28(d); 32 C.F.R. § 1900.13(b)(2).

Furthermore, a waiver of search and review fees is warranted inasmuch as Targeted Justice will report the results of this endeavor on the grounds that Targeted Justice qualifies as a “representative of the news media” and that the records are not sought for commercial use. See 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii))(7); 32 C.F.R. §§ 1900.02(h)(3), 1900.13(i)(2).

See Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973). The Vaughn statement must specify details about each document's sender, recipients, date and time, and subject.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Leonid Ber

title: FOIA Request for All Records Related to DOJ Complaint Number 533252-GXC

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA Request for All Records Related to DOJ Complaint Number 533252-GXC
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To: FOIA Officer, Civil Rights Division
U.S. Department of Justice
Address: 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, NW, Washington, DC 20530-0001
Email: FOIA.Request@usdoj.gov

Date: November 9, 2024

Subject: FOIA Request for All Records Related to DOJ Complaint Number 533252-GXC

Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I request all records related to DOJ Complaint Number 533252-GXC, submitted to the Civil Rights Division on November 9, 2024. This request includes all documentation associated with the complaint, such as:

Internal and External Communications

All emails, letters, and internal notes relating to the intake, review, and handling of DOJ Complaint 533252-GXC.
Correspondence between DOJ personnel, external entities, and any third parties involved in the assessment or investigation of the complaint.
Complaint Review and Processing Records

Documents detailing the assessment criteria, investigative steps, and decisions made in handling this complaint.
Logs or entries from case tracking or management systems indicating the timeline and actions taken.
Personnel Assignments and Roles

Records identifying the personnel involved in processing this complaint, including their roles and decision-making authorities.
Any supervisory or oversight records for individuals directly managing or reviewing this complaint.
Guidance Documents, Policies, and Procedures

Any internal policies, memoranda, or guidance documents used in evaluating DOJ Complaint 533252-GXC, specifically those related to ADA, FOIA, and civil rights compliance.
Any procedural guidelines specific to ADA accommodations in handling complaints by individuals with disabilities.
Documents and Notes on Decision-Making and Outcomes

Records, summaries, or notes reflecting the outcomes of reviews, discussions, or decisions regarding DOJ Complaint 533252-GXC, including any determinations on investigatory steps or referrals.
Accommodation Requirements for Compliance
To ensure ADA compliance and accessibility, I request the following accommodations:

Email-Only Communication: Please send all responses, records, and updates exclusively via email to AabiWR@live.com. Physical mail, phone calls, portal-based communications, or external links should not be used.
Screen-Reader Compatible PDF Format: All documents must be provided in a screen-reader-compatible PDF format to maintain accessibility.
Full Text in Email Body: Where feasible, please include the full text of responses within the email body, avoiding reliance on attachments.
Clear Justifications for Redactions and Denials: For any withheld or redacted records, provide a complete justification, including specific legal exemptions and, where possible, summaries of withheld content.
Identification of FOIA Officers and Supervisory Personnel: Include the full names, titles, email addresses, and phone numbers of all FOIA officers, decision-makers, or supervisors handling this request.
Fee Waiver Request
As this request benefits the public’s understanding of ADA compliance within federal agencies and is not for commercial use, I request a waiver of any associated fees.

Expedited Processing
Due to the urgent public interest in ADA accessibility and civil rights transparency, I request expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E).

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an anticipated timeline for processing. Should any part of this request be denied, please include specific statutory justifications and exemptions.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
Email: AabiWR@live.com
Address: 215 Mountain St, Willimantic, CT 06226

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

title: Detroit Water & Sewerage Dept. Autopay Issues Addendum (Detroit Water and Sewerage Department)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Detroit Water & Sewerage Dept. Autopay Issues Addendum (Detroit Water and Sewerage Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A document showing how many Detroit Water and Sewerage Department (DWSD) customers are signed up for auto payment and currently have delinquencies. If possible, it would be good to have these numbers broken up by the number of customers who are one month in arrears, two months in arrears, three months in arrears, four months in arrears, five months in arrears, six months in arrears, seven months in arrears, eight months in arrears, nine months in arrears, 10 months in arrears, 11 months in arrears, and 12 months in arrears. If it's not possible, or would be overly difficult to break down the document in this way, then please ignore that aspect of this request but still denote how many DWSD customers are signed up for autopayment and have delinquencies.

2. The same document as requested above, or a different document, showing the number of DWSD customers who had delinquencies as a result of a technical issue while being signed up for autopay. Please pull this information for Nov. 1 2023-Nov. 2024 OR this fiscal year OR the most recent 12 month period available, which ever is most readily available.

3. A document showing how many DWSD customers have had accounts with a cash-only status. Please pull this information for Nov. 1 2023-Nov. 2024 OR this fiscal year OR the most recent 12 month period available, which ever is most readily available.

This information will not be used for commercial purposes and is intended to be released to the general public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Laura Herberg

To Whom It May Concern:

Aundra Luckey, Chief, FOIA/PA Branch

950 Pennsylvania Ave., N.W.

Alina M. Semo, Director

David Medeiros
ABI Resources LLC
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335
Email: aabiwr@live.com

Subject: FOIA Request for Detailed Records and ADA-Compliant Communication
FOIA Case No.: 25-00044-F
Subject of Request: Comprehensive and Current Provider Registry Records for Medicaid ABI Waiver Program

Request for Records
I am requesting all records related to the complete and current provider registry associated with the Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. The requested records should include, but are not limited to:

Provider Information: Complete names, physical and email addresses, areas of specialty, and specific services offered.
Enrollment Details: Dates of provider enrollment, current statuses, and any changes in status.
Complaints, Violations, or Actions: All records, investigations, reports, or documentation of complaints, violations, or disciplinary actions involving providers participating in the ABI Waiver Program.
Publicly Available Supporting Documents: Any agency policies or procedural documents detailing how these provider records are maintained, updated, or made available under FOIA.
ADA Accommodation Requirements
As an individual with cognitive impairments resulting from a traumatic brain injury (TBI), I am entitled to specific ADA accommodations to ensure accessible communication. Please adhere to the following accommodations, which are required under ADA standards (42 U.S.C. § 12101):

Email-Only Communication: All responses and updates must be sent via email only, with no portals, external links, or alternate websites.
Text Directly in Email Body: Please include all response text and documentation directly in the body of the email, not as attachments, to ensure accessibility for screen readers.
Clear, Simple Explanations: I require clear, specific explanations for each response, particularly if any records are denied or redacted. Summaries should accompany complex documents.
Named Contact Persons and Accountability: Provide the names, titles, and contact information for all individuals involved in fulfilling this request, including supervisors for accountability.
Timely Updates: Please provide periodic updates on the request status to prevent undue burden on follow-up due to memory challenges related to TBI.
Legal Basis for Request
This request is submitted in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) and requires timely compliance. The information requested is a matter of public interest, directly impacting transparency in Medicaid and disability services. Additionally, the requested accommodations are necessary under ADA provisions to ensure that I have equitable access to the information.

Preferred Format and Delivery
Please send all requested information directly in the email body as outlined. I will not be able to access the information if provided via download links or attachments due to accessibility barriers.

Acknowledgment and Timeline
I request written acknowledgment of this FOIA request within ten (10) business days, as per FOIA’s guidelines, with an estimated completion timeline. Failure to comply with these requests will result in formal complaints to oversight bodies, as I am committed to enforcing compliance under federal transparency and disability rights laws.

Thank you for your attention to these important requirements. I look forward to your prompt and ADA-compliant response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources LLC
Email: aabiwr@live.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-2025-03145
communications.communication:
Subject: Follow-Up on FOIA Request #F-2025-03145 – ADA Accommodation Compliance and Status Update

To: FOIA Requester Service Center
U.S. Department of State
Email: FOIAStatus@state.gov

CC:
Aundra Luckey, Chief, FOIA/PA Branch
Civil Rights Division
U.S. Department of Justice

Alina M. Semo, Director
Office of Government Information Services
National Archives and Records Administration

Dear FOIA Officer,

This is a follow-up regarding my FOIA request #F-2025-03145 submitted to the U.S. Department of State on November 8, 2024. I am requesting confirmation of adherence to the specified ADA accommodations for all records and communications associated with this request. These accommodations are necessary to ensure accessible and effective communication per federal disability standards.

Required ADA Accommodations
Please ensure that all future communications adhere strictly to the following accommodations, as outlined under the ADA and relevant federal accessibility regulations:

Email-Only Communication: Send all updates, responses, records, and notifications exclusively via Muckrock platform. No phone calls, physical mail, portal-based communications, external links, or passwords should be used at any stage.

Direct Text in Email Body: Include response text and relevant documentation directly within the email body whenever feasible to facilitate immediate access with screen readers.

PDF Attachments for Documents: When attachments are necessary, provide documents in clearly labeled PDF format, maintaining the integrity of the original layout for easy navigation and review.

Signed Documents with Responsible Personnel Information: Every document should bear the name, title, and signature of the responsible officer or decision-maker to ensure transparency and accountability.

Simplified Summaries for Complex Records: For any documentation containing complex legal, procedural, or financial language, a simplified summary should accompany the documents to support clear comprehension.

Detailed Justifications for Redactions or Denials: If any portion of the records is redacted or denied, please provide a detailed explanation of the grounds under the relevant statutes, as specified by FOIA law.

Regular Status Updates: To accommodate memory challenges resulting from my traumatic brain injury (TBI), please provide regular email updates regarding the status of this FOIA request to prevent the undue burden of follow-up.

Legal Basis for ADA Accommodations
The accommodations above are required under the ADA and federal accessibility standards, including 42 U.S.C. § 12101. Failure to comply may constitute a barrier to equitable access and therefore a violation of federal law regarding public records and disability rights.

Current Request Status and Estimated Timeline
Based on previous correspondence, I understand that my FOIA request status is “Received.” I kindly request an estimated timeline for the completion of this request and any specific actions or next steps that may be required on my part. Additionally, please confirm in writing that the above accommodations will be consistently applied to all communications and documents throughout this request process.

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for ensuring compliance with these legally mandated accommodations. I look forward to your prompt confirmation and a timeline update.

Sincerely,

David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
39 Kings Hwy STE C
Gales Ferry, CT 06335
Email: AABIWR@LIVE.COM

Please send all requested information directly in the email body as outlined. I will not be able to access the information if provided via download links or attachments due to accessibility barriers.

Acknowledgment and Timeline
I request written acknowledgment of this FOIA request within ten (10) business days, as per FOIA’s guidelines, with an estimated completion timeline. Failure to comply with these requests will result in formal complaints to oversight bodies, as I am committed to enforcing compliance under federal transparency and disability rights laws.

Thank you for your attention to these important requirements. I look forward to your prompt and ADA-compliant response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources LLC
Email: aabiwr@live.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

Subject: FOIA Request for Detailed Records and ADA-Compliant Communication
FOIA Case No.: 25-00044-F
Subject of Request: Comprehensive and Current Provider Registry Records for Medicaid ABI Waiver Program

Request for Records
I am requesting all records related to the complete and current provider registry associated with the Connecticut Medicaid Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) Waiver Program. The requested records should include, but are not limited to:

Provider Information: Complete names, physical and email addresses, areas of specialty, and specific services offered.
Enrollment Details: Dates of provider enrollment, current statuses, and any changes in status.
Complaints, Violations, or Actions: All records, investigations, reports, or documentation of complaints, violations, or disciplinary actions involving providers participating in the ABI Waiver Program.
Publicly Available Supporting Documents: Any agency policies or procedural documents detailing how these provider records are maintained, updated, or made available under FOIA.
ADA Accommodation Requirements
As an individual with cognitive impairments resulting from a traumatic brain injury (TBI), I am entitled to specific ADA accommodations to ensure accessible communication. Please adhere to the following accommodations, which are required under ADA standards (42 U.S.C. § 12101):

Email-Only Communication: All responses and updates must be sent via email only, with no portals, external links, or alternate websites.
Text Directly in Email Body: Please include all response text and documentation directly in the body of the email, not as attachments, to ensure accessibility for screen readers.
Clear, Simple Explanations: I require clear, specific explanations for each response, particularly if any records are denied or redacted. Summaries should accompany complex documents.
Named Contact Persons and Accountability: Provide the names, titles, and contact information for all individuals involved in fulfilling this request, including supervisors for accountability.
Timely Updates: Please provide periodic updates on the request status to prevent undue burden on follow-up due to memory challenges related to TBI.
Legal Basis for Request
This request is submitted in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) and requires timely compliance. The information requested is a matter of public interest, directly impacting transparency in Medicaid and disability services. Additionally, the requested accommodations are necessary under ADA provisions to ensure that I have equitable access to the information.

Preferred Format and Delivery
Please send all requested information directly in the email body as outlined. I will not be able to access the information if provided via download links or attachments due to accessibility barriers.

Acknowledgment and Timeline
I request written acknowledgment of this FOIA request within ten (10) business days, as per FOIA’s guidelines, with an estimated completion timeline. Failure to comply with these requests will result in formal complaints to oversight bodies, as I am committed to enforcing compliance under federal transparency and disability rights laws.

Thank you for your attention to these important requirements. I look forward to your prompt and ADA-compliant response.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
ABI Resources LLC
Email: aabiwr@live.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

David Medeiros
aabiwr@live.com
Dear David Medeiros:
Thank you for contacting the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS), an office of
the National Archives and Records Administration. As you are aware, Congress created OGIS to
serve as the federal Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Ombudsman. We assist the public and
federal agencies by helping them resolve their FOIA disputes, and by addressing their questions
and concerns about the FOIA process.
It appears that you are seeking assistance with a FOIA request currently pending with the U.S.
Department of Justice’s Civil Rights Division. Please note, OGIS cannot compel an agency to
process a request more quickly or ahead of others in the queue. However, in working cases
similar to yours, we have learned that some requesters have had success receiving a more timely
response by refining the scope of a request. If you would like to discuss narrowing your
request—which may allow it to be processed more efficiently— you may wish to contact the
agency's FOIA Public Liaison (FPL). All federal agencies have an FPL, whose role is to explain
the FOIA process and assist requesters with their FOIA requests at any stage of the
administrative process.
Additionally, it is important to know that all federal agencies are required to provide an estimated
date of completion (EDC) when asked (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(7)(B)(ii)). In order to obtain an
estimated date of completion for your request, we recommend that you contact the agency
directly. The FOIA Public Liaison (FPL) for the Civil Rights Division, April Freeman, can be
reached at 202-514-4210.
We hope you find this information useful. At this time, we will take no further action. If you
have questions or concerns that we have not addressed, please contact us again.
Best regards,
The OGIS Staff

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #F-2025-03144
communications.communication:
Subject: Formal Demand for Immediate Remedial Action for Non-Compliance with ADA Accommodations and FOIA Legal Obligations (FOIA Request No. 25-00044-F)

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am submitting this formal demand to address and rectify specific, documented non-compliances related to ADA accommodations and FOIA requirements associated with FOIA request No. 25-00044-F. These non-compliances represent failures to meet federally mandated ADA standards and statutory requirements under both federal and Connecticut FOIA regulations. To ensure compliance with the law, I require immediate corrective action on each point detailed below.

1. Non-Compliance with ADA-Requested Email-Only Communication
Date of Non-Compliance: November 10, 2024
Details: Despite my explicit ADA request for communications to be conducted solely via direct email (not through any portals, links, or external systems), the agency responded through a digital portal. This action contravenes my rights under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and disregards the duty to provide accessible, reasonable accommodations. Federal ADA standards prohibit agencies from imposing communication methods that are inaccessible or unduly burdensome, particularly for individuals with disabilities that affect cognitive or visual processing.

Required Action: Effective immediately, all communications related to FOIA request No. 25-00044-F must be provided exclusively via email, with no external links, portals, or ancillary access requirements. Failure to adopt this modification constitutes a denial of access under ADA standards.

2. Requirement for Direct Text Embedding in Email Body
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: On this date, the agency provided a PDF attachment rather than embedding relevant information directly within the email body. Under ADA Title II and Connecticut General Statutes §§ 1-210 and 1-211, I am entitled to receive information in an accessible format. Embedding the text within the email body ensures compatibility with screen readers, thereby allowing full, unimpeded access to requested information, in compliance with the ADA.

Required Action: All future communications must embed relevant content directly within the body of the email to meet ADA and FOIA accessibility requirements. This modification is essential to ensure I receive information in a format that accommodates my ADA-protected disability.

3. Obligation to Provide Properly Formatted PDF Attachments
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: The provided PDF lacked labeling for date and document type, and did not conform to accessible design standards mandated by ADA Title II and Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act. Specifically, the PDF failed to meet navigability requirements under the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG), which are incorporated into Section 508 requirements for electronic and information technology.

Required Action: All PDF attachments must be fully accessible, labeled by date and document type, and formatted for screen reader compatibility. Failure to adhere to these standards is a violation of ADA accommodations as well as Section 508’s accessibility standards.

4. Mandatory Disclosure of FOIA Officer Identity and Signature
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: The response provided by the agency failed to include the full name, title, and signature of the responsible officer, in direct contravention of Connecticut General Statutes §§ 1-212 and 1-213, which require public officers handling FOIA requests to identify themselves. This is essential for transparency and accountability under both FOIA and ADA.

Required Action: The agency must provide full identification—including name, title, and a clear signature—of the officer responsible for handling and responding to my FOIA request. Non-compliance with this requirement obstructs transparency and violates statutory obligations for public accountability.

5. Provision of Simplified Summaries for Complex Information
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: The agency did not provide a simplified summary for a document containing procedural information. ADA regulations (28 C.F.R. § 35.160) require that communications are as effective for individuals with disabilities as they are for those without, which includes offering simplified summaries when complex information is presented.

Required Action: For all documents containing technical or complex information, a simplified summary must accompany the original text to meet ADA requirements for effective communication. This accommodation is critical for ensuring equitable access to public records as guaranteed by federal law.

6. Requirement for Statutory Justification of Redactions
Details: While no redactions were made in the latest response, it is essential to establish that if any records are redacted in the future, statutory justification will be provided. Under 5 U.S.C. § 552 (federal FOIA) and Connecticut General Statutes Chapter 14, §§ 1-200 to 1-242, any withholding of information requires specific statutory citations and explicit explanations for each redaction.

Required Action: The agency must ensure that any future redactions in records are accompanied by clear statutory justifications in compliance with federal and state FOIA regulations. This action will uphold transparency and guarantee the legal accountability of redaction decisions.

7. Confirmation of ADA Accommodation Compliance
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: The agency has not confirmed compliance with the specific ADA accommodations I have requested. Title II of the ADA and Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act obligate public entities to demonstrate their adherence to accommodation requests and to confirm that all legal requirements are being met.

Required Action: A formal, written confirmation of ADA accommodation compliance is required immediately. This confirmation must address each of my requests and affirm the agency’s commitment to provide effective accommodations in all future communications regarding FOIA request No. 25-00044-F.

Request for Immediate Remedial Action and Legal Adherence
I demand immediate and full compliance with the outlined legal standards for all future responses related to FOIA request No. 25-00044-F. Each issue specified above must be addressed to ensure unqualified adherence to both ADA and FOIA requirements. Further failure to comply with these mandates will be regarded as a continued violation of federal and state law, necessitating formal action to secure my rights under ADA Title II, Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act, federal FOIA, and Connecticut FOIA statutes.

Please confirm receipt of this demand and provide a precise timeline for completion and correction of each item listed. I expect all future communications to meet the highest standards of accessibility, transparency, and compliance with applicable statutes, as required by law.

Sincerely,

David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources

request, you may administratively appeal by writing to the Director, Office of Information Policy U.S. Department of Justice
Civil Rights Division
(OIP), United States Department of Justice, 441 G Street, NW, 6th Floor, Washington, D.C.
20530, or you may submit an appeal through OIP's FOIA STAR portal by creating an account
following the instructions on OIP’s website: https://www.justice.gov/oip/submitandtrackrequest-or-appeal . Your appeal must be postmarked or electronically transmitted within

letter and the envelope should be clearly marked "Freedom of Information Act Appeal." If
possible, please provide a copy of your original request and this response letter with your appeal.

Sincerely,
Aundra Luckey
Freedom of Information/Privacy Acts Unit
Civil Rights Division

November 8, 2024—Sent via email
David Medeiros
aabiwr@live.com
Dear David Medeiros:
Thank you for contacting the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS), an office of
the National Archives and Records Administration. As you are aware, Congress created OGIS to
serve as the federal Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Ombudsman. We assist the public and
federal agencies by helping them resolve their FOIA disputes, and by addressing their questions
and concerns about the FOIA process.
It appears that you are seeking assistance with a FOIA request currently pending with the U.S.
Department of Justice’s Civil Rights Division. Please note, OGIS cannot compel an agency to
process a request more quickly or ahead of others in the queue. However, in working cases
similar to yours, we have learned that some requesters have had success receiving a more timely
response by refining the scope of a request. If you would like to discuss narrowing your
request—which may allow it to be processed more efficiently— you may wish to contact the
agency's FOIA Public Liaison (FPL). All federal agencies have an FPL, whose role is to explain
the FOIA process and assist requesters with their FOIA requests at any stage of the
administrative process.
Additionally, it is important to know that all federal agencies are required to provide an estimated
date of completion (EDC) when asked (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(7)(B)(ii)). In order to obtain an
estimated date of completion for your request, we recommend that you contact the agency
directly. The FOIA Public Liaison (FPL) for the Civil Rights Division, April Freeman, can be
reached at 202-514-4210.
We hope you find this information useful. At this time, we will take no further action. If you
have questions or concerns that we have not addressed, please contact us again.
Best regards,
The OGIS Staff

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

aabiwr@live.com
Dear David Medeiros:
Thank you for contacting the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS), an office of
the National Archives and Records Administration. As you are aware, Congress created OGIS to
serve as the federal Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Ombudsman. We assist the public and
federal agencies by helping them resolve their FOIA disputes, and by addressing their questions
and concerns about the FOIA process.
It appears that you are seeking assistance with a FOIA request currently pending with the U.S.
Department of Justice’s Civil Rights Division. Please note, OGIS cannot compel an agency to
process a request more quickly or ahead of others in the queue. However, in working cases
similar to yours, we have learned that some requesters have had success receiving a more timely
response by refining the scope of a request. If you would like to discuss narrowing your
request—which may allow it to be processed more efficiently— you may wish to contact the
agency's FOIA Public Liaison (FPL). All federal agencies have an FPL, whose role is to explain
the FOIA process and assist requesters with their FOIA requests at any stage of the
administrative process.
Additionally, it is important to know that all federal agencies are required to provide an estimated
date of completion (EDC) when asked (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(7)(B)(ii)). In order to obtain an
estimated date of completion for your request, we recommend that you contact the agency
directly. The FOIA Public Liaison (FPL) for the Civil Rights Division, April Freeman, can be
reached at 202-514-4210.
We hope you find this information useful. At this time, we will take no further action. If you
have questions or concerns that we have not addressed, please contact us again.
Best regards,
The OGIS Staff

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

The University of Oklahoma ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-1160 has been submitted successfully. Greetings- The University of Oklahoma is in receipt of your request. Our office will communicate with departments within the University to identify and retrieve documents responsive to your request. Once those documents are received, they will be reviewed for privileged and confidential information. Upon completion of that review, you will receive notice that the documents are ready and will be transferred based upon your request. As provided for in state law, 51 O.S. § 24A.5.3, the University of Oklahoma may charge for records production, as filed with the County Clerk’s Office, unless your request indicates that it is within the exceptions of the Open Records Act for waiver of fees. Please provide documentation for the basis of any waiver of fees.  Please remember, we are not required to create a new record to respond to requests. We are only required to release documents that the University currently keeps. Also, we are required to release only documents that were available as of the date of the request. title: Mel King School - School-Based Arrests

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Mel King School - School-Based Arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection. 
•	A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

For the School and time period described above, I request the following public records, as defined in G. L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

a.	Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement
b.	Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement
c.	Charge (or charges) including the statute governing the alleged offense 
d.	Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement
e.	Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

title: Arkansas Parole Board Files

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Arkansas Parole Board Files
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Cummings, 

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-101 et seq., I request that the Arkansas Post-Prison Transfer Board (“the Board”) make the below documents available for copying or inspection. 

1) Please provide complete revocation files from the ten (10) most recent revocation hearings conducted by the Board. I request that the Board produce each part of these revocation files authorized pursuant to the Board’s Administrative Directive 17-01(IV)(6)(a), including any and all statements, evidence, narrative explanations, and public records relating to the given parole revocation decision, the violation(s) giving rise to the given parole revocation decision, the sentence imposed for the given parole revocation decision, and any upcoming hearings scheduled related to the given parole revocation decision. In the alternative to the ten most recent revocation files, I request that the Board produce ten (10) random revocation files. 

2) Please provide complete parole files from the ten (10) most recent transfer eligibility and discretionary parole eligibility hearings. I request that the Board produce each part of these parole files authorized pursuant to the Board’s Administrative Directive 17-01(IV)(6)(a), including any and all statements, evidence, narrative explanations, and public records relating to the given parole release decision and any upcoming hearings scheduled related to the given parole release decision. In the alternative to the ten most recent parole files, I request that the Board produce ten (10) random parole files. 

I ask that the Board provide the above records within three business days of receipt of this request, as required by Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(e). I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. I also ask that the Board provide me with a fee estimate prior to fulfilling any request. 

Should any part of the above request be denied, I request the Board provide a written response citing the specific statutory exemption, as required by Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3). If some of the above records are disclosable and others exempt, please provide the disclosable documents and provide the exemption(s) preventing disclosure of the rest per Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(f). If any of the above documents are administratively controlled by a different custodian than the Board, I ask that the Board please provide those custodians’ information, per Ark. Code. Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(3)(C).   

Please note that I am a citizen of Arkansas, and I am using MuckRock’s services to help manage and track my request. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.   

Sincerely, 

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Matthew.

title: Detroit Water and Sewerage Department Autopay Issues (Detroit Water and Sewerage Department)

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Detroit Water and Sewerage Department Autopay Issues (Detroit Water and Sewerage Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A document showing how many Detroit Water and Sewerage Department (DWSD) customers are signed up for autopay.
2. A document showing the number and/or percentage of DWSD autopay customers that have an overdue balance of more than $100
3. A document showing the number and/or percentage of non-autopay DWSD customers that have an overdue balance of more than $100.
4. A document showing the number and/or percentage of DWSD autopay customers who had their water shut off this year (2024) or fiscal year 2024, so far.
5. A document showing the number and/or percentage of non-autopay DWSD customers who've had their water shut off this year (2024) or fiscal year 2024, so far.

For background, I sent a similar request to DWSD Public Affairs Director Bryan Peckinpaugh on Nov. 4, 2024. This was his response:

title: Comprehensive FOIA Request for OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844 (Department Of Health And Human Services, Office For Civil Rights)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Comprehensive FOIA Request for OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844 (Department Of Health And Human Services, Office For Civil Rights)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Comprehensive FOIA Request for OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844

To: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) – Office for Civil Rights (OCR) CC: FOIA Compliance Officers and Relevant Oversight Authorities Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services (CMS) FOIA Division U.S. Department of Justice Civil Rights Division – ADA Compliance Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS) Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)

Dear FOIA Officers, Supervisory Officers, and Relevant Authorities,

This letter constitutes a formal and detailed FOIA request for all records associated with OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844. This request is made under the federal Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) and relevant state FOIA statutes, including the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-200 et seq.). As a brain injury survivor, whistleblower, and Medicaid consumer advocate, I seek these records to ensure transparency, procedural integrity, and ADA compliance.

Scope of Request: This FOIA request encompasses all relevant records associated with OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844, including records created, received, reviewed, or used by the Office for Civil Rights, CMS, DOJ Civil Rights Division, Connecticut DSS, and CHRO. The scope of this request is intended to capture all documentation, communications, and procedural records relevant to my case, OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844, which involves complaints regarding ADA non-compliance, discrimination, and procedural obstructions within DSS and CHRO.

Specifically, I request comprehensive disclosure of records under the following categories:

1. Complete Internal and External Communications
Emails, internal messages, letters, and digital communications related to OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.
Communications between OCR personnel, CMS representatives, DOJ Civil Rights Division, Connecticut DSS, CHRO, and other stakeholders concerning ADA compliance, civil rights protections, whistleblower retaliation, and procedural handling.
Detailed logs of communications (including sender, recipient, date, and subject) between involved agencies and individuals in connection with OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.

2. Personnel Documentation and Oversight Records
Records detailing the job roles, responsibilities, and titles of all OCR, CMS, DSS, and CHRO personnel involved in handling or overseeing my case, including specific ADA compliance roles, civil rights enforcement roles, and whistleblower handling responsibilities.
Organizational charts and supervisory oversight documentation for all personnel involved in or overseeing OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.

3. Case Handling and Decision-Making Documentation
Internal and external case reports, status updates, decision-making logs, case processing logs, workflow charts, and progress reports specific to OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.
Detailed descriptions and timelines for each action taken, including explanations for any delays, incomplete responses, or procedural omissions related to this case.
Records outlining guidance documents and internal policies referenced in processing OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844, particularly ADA, FOIA, and civil rights compliance guidelines.

4. Contracts, Agreements, and Financial Records
Any contracts, agreements, MOUs, or financial transactions relevant to OCR’s engagement with external consultants or resources in relation to my case.
Records reflecting financial allocations and expenditures applied to the investigation, management, or oversight of OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844, including budgets for ADA compliance and civil rights enforcement.

5. Policy and Procedural Documentation
Complete internal policies, procedural guidelines, and compliance standards related to OCR’s handling of ADA complaints, civil rights compliance, whistleblower protections, and procedural integrity.
OCR’s guidelines and directives for ADA accommodation and compliance processing, especially regarding brain injury survivors, Medicaid consumer protections, and the handling of complex FOIA requests.

6. Historical Records and Documentation of Previous Complaints
Complaint histories, retaliation protections, and whistleblower complaint records involving personnel handling OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.
Previous investigations, formal complaints, and procedural changes related to ADA, FOIA, and whistleblower protections within OCR, DSS, or CHRO.

7. Complete Document Histories, Drafts, and Revisions
All drafts, versions, and annotated notes of official documents generated in relation to OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.
Complete histories of document revisions, including tracked changes, comments, and updates by OCR, DSS, or CHRO personnel.

8. Audit Findings, Compliance Reviews, and Corrective Action Records
Internal or third-party audit findings, compliance reviews, and corrective action plans related to the procedural handling of ADA complaints, FOIA administration, and whistleblower protections, particularly those affecting OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.
Documentation of federal or state compliance investigations or oversight reports relevant to OCR’s ADA and civil rights compliance responsibilities.

9. FOIA Compliance and Denials, Redactions, and Justifications
Documentation of any previous FOIA responses, denials, redactions, and exemptions applied to my requests concerning OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844.
For any redactions, I request a clear explanation, including specific legal exemptions cited, justifications, and summaries of withheld content to maintain transparency and accessibility.

Accommodation Requirements for Compliance
To ensure that all records are accessible and ADA-compliant, please apply the following accommodations consistently:

Exclusive Email-Only Communication:
Send all responses, records, and updates exclusively via email to AabiWR@live.com. Do not use physical mail, phone calls, portal-based communications, or any external links. This ensures uninterrupted and barrier-free access to information.

Accessible Document Formatting:
Include the full text of each response within the email body, and attach all supporting documents as labeled PDFs, organized by category and date.
Ensure documents are screen reader-compatible to maintain accessibility.

Clear Justifications for Redactions and Denials:
For any withheld or redacted records, provide a complete justification, including specific statutes or legal exemptions. Include a summary of redacted content wherever feasible.

Identification of Responsible FOIA Officers and Supervisory Personnel:
Provide the full names, titles, email addresses, and phone numbers of all FOIA officers, decision-makers, or supervisors handling this request.

Request for Expedited Processing
Given the significance of OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844 and the public interest in ADA compliance, civil rights enforcement, and procedural integrity within DSS and CHRO, I request expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). Delayed access to these records obstructs effective oversight and hinders efforts to protect vulnerable populations.

Justification for Fee Waiver
This request seeks information critical to the public interest regarding ADA enforcement, civil rights protections, and DSS’s handling of Medicaid-related complaints. Disclosure will directly benefit public understanding and support governmental accountability. Therefore, I request a waiver of all associated fees, as this request is not for commercial purposes.

Timeline for Response
Under FOIA, I request acknowledgment within the statutory timeframe, along with a timeline for compliance. Please notify me promptly if clarifications or additional processing time are needed. Contact me exclusively at AabiWR@live.com.

Legal Basis for This Request
This request and appeal are grounded in the following statutes:

5 U.S.C. § 552 (Federal FOIA) – Governing the public’s right to access federal records.
Connecticut FOIA (C.G.S. §§ 1-200 to 1-242) – Requiring prompt, transparent access to state records.
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.) – Ensuring reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities.
Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794) – Mandating equal access and accommodation for individuals with disabilities in federally funded programs.
Thank you for your attention to this important matter. Full and prompt disclosure of these records is crucial for ensuring transparency, ADA compliance, and public accountability within the government’s handling of ADA-related complaints and civil rights protections.

Sincerely,

David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
Email: AabiWR@live.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2025-00501-FOIA-PHS
communications.communication:
Subject: Demand for Immediate Compliance with ADA and FOIA Standards for FOIA Request No. 2025-00501-FOIA-PHS

To: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) – Office for Civil Rights (OCR)
CC: FOIA Compliance Officers, HHS Supervisory Authorities, and Relevant Oversight Agencies

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am submitting this formal demand to ensure that all responses associated with FOIA request No. 2025-00501-FOIA-PHS are in strict compliance with both the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552) and ADA requirements under Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act (42 U.S.C. § 12132). My request for these records involves OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844 and addresses ADA compliance, civil rights enforcement, and whistleblower protections within government programs.

This demand details critical deficiencies in your recent communications and reiterates the required accommodations and FOIA standards necessary to achieve legal compliance.

1. Non-Compliance with ADA Accommodation: Exclusive Email-Only Communication
Date of Non-Compliance: November 10, 2024
Details: The agency issued an acknowledgment through a portal link, disregarding my ADA-mandated request for exclusive email-based communications. Under Title II of the ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12132) and federal FOIA guidelines, individuals with disabilities are entitled to reasonable accommodations that avoid barriers to accessibility. Requiring use of a portal to receive responses is non-compliant, as this method presents undue burdens and inhibits effective access for individuals with visual or cognitive disabilities.

Required Action: Immediately provide all future FOIA-related communications and records solely via email, directly to AabiWR@live.com, without the use of portal systems, links, or external access barriers. This adjustment is essential to comply with ADA and FOIA standards for reasonable accommodations and equitable access.

2. Requirement for Accessible Document Formatting in Emails
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: Records provided to date lack essential formatting for screen-reader compatibility, particularly when attachments are sent without embedded text or accessible formatting. Compliance with Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act and ADA guidelines mandates that text is embedded directly within emails or that accessible PDF formats are used to ensure compatibility with assistive technologies.

Required Action: All responses must embed key content within the email body and attach supporting documents as screen reader-compatible, labeled PDFs organized by category and date. This structure is necessary to facilitate navigable, ADA-compliant document access.

3. Full Identification and Accountability of FOIA Officers and Decision-Makers
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: Communications to date have omitted critical identification information, including the full names, titles, and contact information of the officers responsible for handling this request. Under both Connecticut FOIA statutes (§§ 1-212 and 1-213) and general ADA standards for transparency, it is essential to provide full identification of individuals responsible for the management and oversight of FOIA requests.

Required Action: Moving forward, all responses must include the full name, title, and contact information (including email and phone number) of the designated FOIA officer and any supervisory personnel involved. This adherence to transparency is non-negotiable under both ADA and FOIA obligations.

4. Requirement for Detailed Redaction Justifications
Details: If any records are redacted or withheld, it is imperative to provide a complete statutory justification for each redaction, along with summaries or descriptions of redacted content where permissible. Under FOIA (5 U.S.C. § 552) and corresponding state statutes, agencies are required to disclose specific legal exemptions and reasons for each instance of redaction to ensure transparency and protect the rights of requestors.

Required Action: All future redactions must include an explicit citation of the legal grounds for redaction and a description of withheld content to maintain transparency and accessibility.

5. Provision of Simplified Summaries for Technical Documents
Date of Non-Compliance: November 8, 2024
Details: ADA guidelines (28 C.F.R. § 35.160) mandate that communications be equally effective for individuals with disabilities. Complex documents or procedural communications require simplified summaries to facilitate comprehension, especially for individuals with cognitive impairments.

Required Action: Provide simplified summaries for all complex or procedural documents to ensure ADA-compliant accessibility and equitable comprehension of FOIA responses. This accommodation is crucial to maintain effective communication and full access under ADA standards.

6. Confirmed Compliance with All Requested Accommodations
Date of Non-Compliance: November 10, 2024
Details: No written confirmation was provided indicating compliance with requested ADA accommodations. Title II of the ADA and Section 508 require public agencies to confirm and implement reasonable accommodations effectively, thus providing confirmation of compliance for transparency and accountability.

Required Action: The agency must provide a formal, written acknowledgment confirming compliance with each ADA accommodation requested in relation to this FOIA request. This includes adherence to exclusive email-only communication, accessible formatting, clear redaction justifications, and identification of responsible personnel.

Request for Expedited Processing and Fee Waiver
In addition to standard processing requirements, I request expedited processing for FOIA request No. 2025-00501-FOIA-PHS. Given the significant public interest and potential civil rights implications of OCR Transaction Number: 01-25-592844, timely access to these records is critical. Under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E), expedited processing is warranted to uphold accountability and to support public awareness of ADA enforcement within federally funded programs.

Additionally, I request a fee waiver for this FOIA request, as disclosure is in the public interest and contributes significantly to government transparency and accountability in matters of ADA and civil rights compliance. This request is strictly non-commercial and aims to promote public understanding of these issues.

Timeline for Compliance and Legal Basis
This FOIA request and ADA accommodation appeal are grounded in the following federal statutes:

Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552): Governing public access to federal records, including requirements for response timelines and specific legal grounds for any redactions or denials.
Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12132): Mandating reasonable accommodations to ensure access to public records for individuals with disabilities.
Section 508 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794d): Requiring accessible electronic and information technology in federally funded programs.
Please confirm receipt of this demand and provide a precise timeline for compliance with the above requirements. All responses must be in full adherence to ADA and FOIA standards and furnished exclusively to AabiWR@live.com in the specified accessible formats.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
Email: AabiWR@live.com
